p: SARS-CoV was isolated and identified in 2003, belonging to lineage B of the genus β-coronavirus. Fever and respiratory symptoms are the most common signs of the infection, and additional GI symptoms also appear as anorexia, nausea, vomiting, abdominal pain, and diarrhea. A retrospective study investigated 752 people with SARS-CoV infection and indicated that approximately 20% of patients had diarrhea in their initial stages [ 32]. Another investigation showed that 55 of 75 patients with SARS-CoV infection presented watery stools approximately 1 week after onset [ 33]. Altogether, approximately 20–25% of SARS patients will have diarrhea [ 2].
